safire.learning.models.multilayer_perceptron_classifier module¶

class safire.learning.models.multilayer_perceptron_classifier.MultilayerPerceptron(inputs, n_in, n_out, n_layers, n_hidden_list, hidden_activation=<theano.tensor.elemwise.Elemwise object at 0x000000000AFC2438>, rng=<mtrand.RandomState object at 0x000000000D7D87C8>, L1_w=0.0, L2_w=0.0, hidden_layer_params=None, log_regression_params=None)[source]¶

Bases: safire.learning.models.base_supervised_model.BaseSupervisedModel

Basic multi-layer perceptron class.

A multilayer perceptron is a feedforward artificial neural network model that has one layer or more of hidden units and nonlinear activations. Intermediate layers usually have as activation function tanh or the sigmoid function (defined here by a HiddenLayer class) while the top layer is a softmax layer (defined here by the class LogisticRegression).

L1()[source]¶

L1 norm ; one regularization option is to enforce L1 norm to be small.

Returns:Returns the number, not the function to compute it it.
L2()[source]¶

Square of L2 norm ; one regularization option is to enforce L2 norm to be small.

Returns:Returns the number, not the function to compute it.
error(y)[source]¶

Computes the proportion of misclassified examples. Again, this is the same as the error of the logistic regression layer.

Parameters:y (theano.tensor.TensorType) – Corresponds to a vector that gives for each example the correct label.
Returns:The proportion of incorrectly classified instances.
Raises:TypeError
negative_log_likelihood(y)[source]¶

Computes the negative log likelihood of a response vector. Negative log likelihood of the MLP is given by the negative log likelihood of the output of the model, computed in the logistic regression layer.

Parameters:y (theano.tensor.TensorType) – Corresponds to a vector that gives for each example the correct label.
Returns:The negative log likelihood of the given response under the model.
